    • Field Detail

      • LEFT_TERM

        static final String LEFT_TERM
        The left term - can be a variable or a constant.

      • RIGHT_TERM

        static final String RIGHT_TERM
        The right term - can be a variable or a constant.

      • TRANSITIVITY_VAR_LEFT

        static final String TRANSITIVITY_VAR_LEFT
        The left transitivity variable.

      • TRANSITIVITY_VAR_RIGHT

        static final String TRANSITIVITY_VAR_RIGHT
        The right transitivity variable.

      • LOWER_BOUND

        static final String LOWER_BOUND
        The lower bound on the number of rounds to run. Can be zero (0) or one (1). A lower bound of zero is a special kind of path - the Zero Length Path. A zero length path connects a vertex to itself (in graph parlance). In the context of arbitrary length paths it means we bind the input onto the output regardless of whether they are actually connected via the path or not.

      • UPPER_BOUND

        static final String UPPER_BOUND
        The upper bound on the number of rounds to run.

      • MIDDLE_TERM

        static final String MIDDLE_TERM
        The middle term - can be a variable or a constant.

      • EDGE_VAR

        static final String EDGE_VAR
        The variable representing the visited edge. Bound using the binding from the middle term. Only used by ALP service when projecting edges.

      • DROP_VARS

        static final String DROP_VARS
        A set of intermediate variables (VarNodes) used by the ALP node that should be dropped from the solutions after each round.
